title: Keep money in bank or cash given inflation and RIR

content.question: Assume that the inflation rate is <math alttext="10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn></math> percent and a bank account effectively yields a real rate of interest of negative <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> percent per year. Would a person be better off keeping money in the bank account or in cash?

choices.label: Cash, because it returns <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> percent more per year than the bank does.
Cash, because it avoids losing <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> percent per year.
The bank account, because it returns <math alttext="15" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>15</mn></math> percent more per year than holding cash does.
The bank account, because the loss is less than it is when holding cash.
The bank account, because while the real interest rate is negative, the real return is positive.

content.answer: The bank account, because the loss is less than it is when holding cash.
